sentences.en: a hankering for a wealthy lifestyle
Evolution might have played an important part in the human hankering for salt.
sentences.cn: 进化可能在人对于盐的渴求中扮演了重要的角色.

sentences.en: From time to time we all get a hankering for something a little different.
sentences.cn: 我们每个人偶尔都会渴望有点变化。

sentences.en: Have you always had a hankering to be an actress?
sentences.cn: 你是否一直渴望成为一名演员？

sentences.en: He actually gets the job he is hankering after, as art director.
sentences.cn: 他最后得到了他梦寐以求的艺术指导的工作.

sentences.en: He had a hankering to own a car.
He has been hankering to spend an evening talking with you.
sentences.cn: 他一直渴望能找一天跟你谈一晚.

sentences.en: It doesn't really sound like you have a hankering for anything in particular at all.
sentences.cn: 我也说不清楚想吃什么.

sentences.en: Most of us have a hankering for the good things on both sides of the line.
sentences.cn: 我们中间大部分人都热切盼望两方面的好东西.

sentences.en: There was always an undercurrent of greediness, a hankering, and sense of waste.
sentences.cn: 总是存在着一种贪得无厌的暗流, 一种非分之想, 一种蹉跎的感觉.

sentences.en: They all want me dead, and are hankering for my money.
sentences.cn: 他们都指望我死, 想得到我的钱.

trans.tran_en: a strong wish to have or do something

trans.tran_cn: 渴望( hanker的现在分词 )，渴望得到，渴求
